page.description: When you have a List with an associated Detail View and you edit the data in one of the rows of the List, an icon (whose appearance you can customize) is shown in the List row to indicate that the List row has data that has been edited, but not yet synchronized.

section.description: You can now indicate the dirty fields in a List row that has been edited by specify a custom CSS class to apply to the Detail View control if the field value has been edited. For example in the image shown below, you can see that the first row in the List has been edited, and you can now also see that the field in that row that was edited was the city field that was changed to 'Frankfurt'.
To indicate the CSS class that you want to apply to dirty fields, open the List builder and set the 'Dirty control class name' property.
